name: Cox's Bazar

The town also features marine drive roads, seafood, and vibrant beach life that attracts tourists all year round.

name: Sreemangal
description: Sreemangal, located in the northeastern part of Bangladesh, is celebrated for its endless tea gardens, tranquil nature, and rich biodiversity. Visitors can explore Lawachara National Park, observe rare wildlife, and enjoy a peaceful retreat surrounded by green hills and rainforests.

name: Sundarbans
description: The Sundarbans, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is the largest mangrove forest in the world, spreading across southern Bangladesh. It is home to a unique ecosystem and rare species including the majestic Royal Bengal Tiger, estuarine crocodiles, and spotted deer. It offers a thrilling experience for eco-tourists and nature lovers.

name: Sajek
description: Sajek Valley is a hill destination located in the Rangamati District of Bangladesh. Often referred to as the 'Queen of Hills', it is famous for its cloud-covered mountains, tribal lifestyle, and scenic views of sunrise and sunset. It's one of the most peaceful and picturesque places to explore.
